subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Deletion Accumulation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitophagy as a metabolic regulator and mitochondrial quality control mechanism influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mitochondrial quality control processes including mitophagy, fusion/fission, and biogenesis as drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial quality control independent of mitophagy but related to mitochondrial maintenance and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitophagy-mediated metabolic homeostasis as a key mechanism delaying aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial quality control via mitophagy and mitochondria-derived vesicles (MDVs) in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial lifecycle including mitophagy and organelle homeostasis as central to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitophagy-related mitochondrial dysfunction to chronic inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates mitochondrial autophagy (mitophagy), inflammation, and mitochondrial dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial DNA mutations, dysfunction, and reactive oxygen species causing oxidative damage driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes robust electron transfer chain assembly and oxidative phosphorylation efficiency reducing oxidative stress in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mitochondrial dysfunction via PGC-1/ERR axis deregulation affecting energy metabolism and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General mitochondrial theory highlighting conserved mitochondrial dysfunction mechanisms driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links environmental pollutants causing mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative damage accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on dysfunction of mitochondrial respiratory complexes as a core feature of mitochondrial aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Conceptualizes mitochondrial dysfunction as the weakest link in aging network, involving mtDNA damage and immune receptor-mediated dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial bioenergetics impairment as a driver of aging and related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Specifically addresses accumulation of mitochondrial DNA deletions with age contributing to dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links calorie restriction and SIRT1 activation to mitochondrial biogenesis and DNA maintenance affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial homeostasis including DNA integrity and regenerative capacity in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial role in conserved aging mechanisms including DNA damage and dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-to-Nuclear Communication and Epigenetic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial signaling to nucleus and epigenetic modulation by mitochondrial metabolites regulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-to-Nuclear Communication and Epigenetic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes integration of mitochondrial redox state, calcium signaling, and bioenergetics as metabolic nexus influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-to-Nuclear Communication and Epigenetic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial superoxide signaling and tissue-specific ROS effects modulating longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-to-Nuclear Communication and Epigenetic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction to stem cell senescence and epigenetic regulation affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-to-Nuclear Communication and Epigenetic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial adaptation to moderate hypoxia improving function and promoting healthy aging.
